step.name: add-attribute
step.short-description: Add (or replace) an attribute on a set of elements

description.para: The document to add (or replace) the attribute on.
The XSLT match pattern that selects the element(s) to add (or replace) the attribute on. If not specified, the root element is used.
This must be an XSLT match pattern that matches an element. If it matches any other kind of node, error is raised.
The name of the attribute. This may contain a namespace specification.

summary.para: The p:add-attribute step adds (or replaces) an attribute. This is done for the element(s) matched by the match option.

listitem.para: Takes the document appearing on its source port.
Processes the elements that match the pattern in the match option:
If a selected element does not contain an attribute with the name given in the attribute-name option, an attribute with this name and a value as given in the attribute-value option is added to it.
If a selected element already has such an attribute, its value is replaced with the value given in the attribute-value option.
The resulting document appears on its result port.

description.para: The p:add-attribute step can only set a single attribute. The step can be used to set multiple attributes at once.

detail.para: You cannot use this step to add or change a namespace declaration. Attempting to do so will result in error .

Note, however, that it is possible to add an attribute whose namespace is not in scope on the element it is added to. The XProc namespace fixup mechanism will take care of handling this and add the appropriate namespace declarations.

example.title: Adding/replacing an attribute
example.para: This example adds a type="special" attribute to all text elements. One of the input text elements already has such an attribute, but with a different value. This existing attribute is replaced.

description.para: It is a dynamic error if the selection pattern matches a node which is not an element.
